Summary: The OCBC Al Scholarship is designed to develop talented individuals who can lead the implementation of Al in banking and provide better customer value. Benefits include full tuition fees, allowances, and a 4-week attachment to the Al Lab. After graduation, recipients will have a one-year rotation covering various Al areas and will be mentored by bank specialists. Eligible applicants must be enrolled in Al-related postgraduate programs, have a strong interest in working for OCBC, and not hold any other scholarship. Applications are open from 1 September to 25 September for students of any nationality. Prior experience or achievements in Al-related work are preferred. For more information, visit the website or email [REDACTED_EMAIL].
